channel.title: Anachromystic Podcast
channel.description: Two grizzled veterans of the first dot-com bubble discuss technology.

item.title: Tools of the Trade for Freelance Developers
item.description: In this episode, Ted and Craig discuss the tools they use for managing their consulting businesses: time tracking, invoicing, clients, projects, etc. Tools discussed include Freshbooks, Basecamp, Pivotal Tracker, Trac, Lighthouse, FogBugz, git and Subversion (again), GitHub, Emurse, and even Pandora.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Getting People to Do What You Want
item.description: In this episode, Craig and Ted welcome their old colleague Marco to discuss getting people to do what you want.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Producing Videos for Online Distribution
item.description: Craig's next venture is focused around video production for online promotion leveraging distribution sites like YouTube, Viddler, Vimeo, etc. In this episode he explains some of the lessons learned thus far.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Developer's Toolbox
item.description: In this week's episode, Craig and Ted discuss the tools they use for development: IDE's, debuggers, profilers, text editors, refactoring, continuous integration, testing, and more.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Tales of Disk Failure and Massive Parallelisation
item.description: In this episode, Craig tells his tale of laptop hard drive failure and Ted brags about his latest gig using massive parallelisation to speed-up an excruciatingly slow task.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: We've Got a Podcast, and Java is Dead!
item.description: In this episode, Craig and Ted discuss Scala vs. Ruby, Pair Programming, Cloud Computing, and the death of the Java programming language.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: The Perfect Programming Language
item.description: In this episode, Craig and Ted discuss the features they'd like to have in their perfect programming language.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Making the Move from Salary to Freelance
item.description: In this episode, Ted and Craig interview their old colleague Larry about his recent jump from Salaryville to Freelancington.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Spinning Up for a New Client or Project
item.description: This week Ted and Craig discuss the first things they do when starting a new project or working with a new client, from time tracking to requirements gathering, setting expectations, estimating work effort, and recording correspondence for posterity.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Database Dichotomies
item.description: In this episode Craig and Ted discuss Friendfeed's move to a schema-less database, the Oracle-Sun merger and what it might mean for MySQL, hosting providers, iPhone development, and the Twitter OAuth security hole.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Crazy Java Generics
item.description: In this episode, Ted and Craig interview their old colleague Eric about the crazy stuff he's doing in Java with generics and reflection. This one is very tech heavy; you've been warned.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: The Perfect Programming Language Continued
item.description: In this episode Ted and Craig continue their discussion of the traits they would desire in the perfect programming language, with a couple tangents on Google Wave and the podcast web site design.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Ted's Million-Dollar Idea
item.description: In this episode, Ted pitches his latest and greatest multi-million-dollar business idea to Craig, which leads to a discussion on successes and failures in the dot-com industry, and why The Right Way to do software development seems so obvious yet so few organizations manage to pull it off.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Getting Started with Ruby on Rails
item.description: In this episode, Craig grills Ted about getting started with Ruby on Rails.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Interview with John Gallagher of Synaptic Mishap
item.description: In this episode Craig and Ted interview John Gallagher from Synaptic Mishap about his latest project: time tracking without timers.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: Dot-Com War Stories and Listener Feedback
item.description: In this episode, Craig and Ted answer a listener's request to discuss git versus Subversion, and read and respond to a listener e-mail about using Bayesian logic for automated time tracking. To wrap things up, Craig praises new start-up Blellow and Ted waxes nostalgic about Yammer.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: FreeNAS and the VMware Hypervisor
item.description: Craig went off the deep end during a recent holiday weekend and repurposed an old PC as the mother of all network storage devices.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

item.title: The Perfect Programming Language Finale
item.description: In this episode, Craig takes the conversation about the perfect programming language to a whole new level.
item.itunes:author: Ted Davis
item.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux

channel.itunes:author: Ted Davis
channel.itunes:keywords: technology, dot-com, java, ruby, rails, iphone, linux
channel.itunes:subtitle: Technology Triage
channel.itunes:summary: Two grizzled veterans of the first dot-com bubble discuss technology.
